713890f-a.text:
31-33 West 57th Street, north side, east of Sixth Avenue. No. 31, at the right, houses the Sohmer Piano Company, and the excavation marks the future location of the Chickering Building.
About 1920.
Gift of E. M. Jenks.

713887f-a.text:
West 5 7th Street,looking West,showing the Sixth Avenue "L", since demolished,and The Great Northern Hotel on the south
side of the Street.
June IE,I924.
Standard Photographic Service,
Now York.

713888f-a.text:
West 57th, north west corner and looking towards the East side of Sixth Avenue, showing the "L" Station at West 57th Street. The sign of the Alps Restaurant may be seen on the East side.
June 17,1924
Standard Photographic Service,
New York.

709589f-a.text:
The Sixth Avenue "L" between W. 57th Street and W. 59th Street, looking northwards, showing the Alps Restaurant on the East side and the Terminal Station of elevated.
June 17, 1924
Standard Photographic Service,
New York.

713898f-a.text:
119-147 West 57th Street, north side, between Sixth and Seventh Avenues. The two five-story residences at the right will soon give way to a fourteen-story office building. The Calvary Baptist Church, in the center, will stand until 1929, when it will be replaced by the Hotel Salisbury, owned by and housing the church. The Chase National Bank building and the residence beyond the church, will still stand in 1935.

June, 1925.

713886f-a.text:
West 57th Street, at and adjoining the N.W. corner of Sixth Ave. Also shown is Sixth Ave., at, adjoining and north of the N.W. corner of West 57th Street. Prominent building shown is the Hotel Buckingham.

About 1925.

Camera Craft.

713894f-a.text:
101-123 West 57th Street, at, adjoining and west of the N.W. corner of Sixth Avenue. The buildings are, from right to left: Buckingham Apartments, New Metropolis Club, Steinway Building, and at the left, Calvary Baptist Church. Within a year the church will demolish this building, and erect the sixteen-story Hotel Salisbury, which will house the church and thus become the first skyscraper church.
1928.
Sigurd Fischer.

709585f-a.text:
East side of north end of Sixth Avenue, 57th to 59th Streets; Athletic Club Building etc.
March 28, 1928.
P.L.Sperr, Photographer.

57th Street, north side, east from but not including Sixth Avenue.

709590f-a.text:
Sixth Avenue (foreground, from right to left), from W. 58th Street (right), to Central Park South (W. 59th Street, center), showing a glimpse of Central Park and its Fifth Avenue outline. The photographer is viewing north eastward from Steinway Hall at No. 109 W. 57th Street and thru two clearances. The first one seen is at the N.W. corner of 58th Street and at which will rise the 40 story Barbizon - Plaza. The other is the site for the 35 storied St. Moritz.
August 21, 1929.
P.L. Sperr

713893f-a.text:
100 2: 108 West 57th Street, at, adjoining and west of the S.W. corner of Sixth Avenue. (left), showing a cleared space where 3 former, 4 and 5 story buildings stood. These were numbered 1O2, 104 and 106. At the extreme right appears a portion of the Lotus Club building,
No. 11O W. 57th Street.
March 17, 1938.
P. L. Sperr,

1558269.title: 50 West 57th Street (Fifth Avenue - Sixth Avenue)
1558269.folder: 50 West 57th Street (Fifth Avenue - Sixth Avenue), Manhattan, NY

713884f-a.text:
39 West 57th Street, north side, east of Sixth Avenue.
1912.

713891f.text:
37-39 West 57th Street, north side, east of Sixth Avenue. By 1925 these houses will be replaced by a twelve-story building.
1912.

713896f-a.text:
109-113 West 57th Street, north side, west of Sixth Avenue. Between 1920 and 1925 these houses will be replaced by the present Steinway Building.
About 1911.
